intro: Voglera, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with thick, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water. Voglera thrives in well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant, making it well-suited for xeriscaping. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in gardens in regions with similar climatic conditions.
